data: Osservazioni sulla lingua dei graffiti segestani
O. Parlangèli, «Osservazioni sulla lingua dei graffiti segestani», Kokalos 13 (1967): 19–29
The text is placed on the underside of the foot. The letters have been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make them more legible.

The text consists of two inscriptions, arranged on two different sides of the same object. 
                                        The first one (face a) is on the underside of the foot: it is arranged in a clockwise spiral, on one line. 
                                        The second one (face b) is on the underside of the foot: it is arranged in a clockwise spiral, on one line.
                                        On both faces the text has been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make it more legible.

2[---]ΙΧϜΟΥΓΟΤΙ[---]

The text is placed on the underside of the foot; it is arranged in a clockwise spiral. It is not certain where the inscription begins. The letters have been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make them more legible.
Ambrosini, 1970, A proposito di una recente pubblicazione sulla lingua dei graffiti di Segesta
1ΤΙΤΕΛΑΙ ΜΕΤΙΑ̣Α̣Ι

The text consists of two inscriptions, arranged on two different parts of the same object. 
                                        The first one (fragment a) is on the underside of the foot: it is arranged in a clockwise spiral, on two lines. 
                                        The second one (fragment b) is on the bottom of the interior of the cup and is arranged following a linear pattern on four lines.
